data.question: Bread and butter —— my favourite breakfast.
The police —— controlling the traffic.
data.moreDetails: (Police, people, cattle, sheep, folk, crowd -> plural)

data.question: A herd of cattle —— grazing in the field.
data.moreDetails: (if the word herd, group, gang, etc comes with above nouns, a singular verb follows it.)

data.question: I with my friends —— playing cricket.
The teachers along with the principal —— attending the seminar.
data.moreDetails:
(with, together with, along with, as well as, as much as, in addition to, rather
than, in the company of, besides, like, unlike, accompanied, by -> any of these
words come in a sentence, the verb follows the first subject.

data.question: Neither ministers nor the chief minister —— there.
Not only the teacher but the students —— also present in the class.
data.moreDetails:
(neither - nor, either - or, not only but also, both, and -> any of these
co relatives comes in sentence verb follows the second subject.

data.question: My grand father and guardian —— come.
The secretary and cashier —— arrested.
data.moreDetails:
(An article (a, an, the) or a possessive noun (my, our, your, their, his, her, its
comes with both nouns use plural verb. It is comes with both nouns use
plural verb. If it comes with a single noun use singular verb).

data.question: This scissors —— blunt.
data.moreDetails:
(Spectacles, Scissors, Pliers, binocular, pants, shoes, socks, chappals etc
follows plural verb)

data.question: A pair of pants —— for my son.
data.moreDetails: (If the words a pair of, comes with above nouns use singular verb only).

data.question: One of my —— coming.
data.moreDetails: (One of the number of -> subject plural, verb singular)

data.question: More than one —— playing outside.
data.moreDetails:
(More than one, many a -> use singular subject and verb after these
phrases).
